review: We bought the Amazon Fire TV to supplement our viewing options for times when the satellite service goes out because of heavy cloudcover, rain or snow.  I considered making this purchase for months because I was unsure whether our DSL service would be capable of streaming video. Well, I finally bought the Amazon Fire TV and started the installation. I had no trouble connecting the box to our TV, but for some reason, I could not get my 'communications company-supplied' DSL modem-router to accept the password that would allow the box to connect wirelessly to my network.  A little frustrated, I got out a long ethernet cable that we had from one of last computer set-ups and, with fingers crossed, I plugged the box directly into the router.  Excelsior! To my surprise and relief, it worked great so now we have an additional video viewing alternative to the satelliteservice and our antenna "over the air" local channels.  We love it, especially with all the no-cost films and TV shows on Prime Instant video.
author: PK Burket
